attributes.action: Improve the morale of NHS working staff by reducing the disparity in wages
attributes.background: The morale of the working staff in the NHS is at an all time low ebb. So it's no surprise that they take little pleasure in going to work, and that enthusiasm is lacking. A committee is needed to balance the difference in wages and working conditions between the different tiers of the hierarchy.
attributes.additional_details: I have had firsthand experience in this matter, visiting hospitals once a month for the last 10 years for treatment. After speaking to numerous members of the nursing staff, it became apparent that a large majority were unhappy with the working conditions and the difference in pay between themselves and more senior doctors in the NHS. I wish for this matter to be discussed, and for the balancing of wages to be considered by a committee.

attributes.action: Allow parents to use tax-free childcare vouchers to increase schools funding
attributes.background:
Schools funding in England is at a critical low - some are threatening a 4-day week to reduce the financial deficit.  This will profoundly affect our children's education.  
My local school receives just £15.16 per child per day.  It is not enough to cover even basic teaching requirements.
attributes.additional_details:
The idea:
Many working parents like me pay into a childcare voucher scheme for under-5s, where up to £243 per month can be used tax-free towards nursery.  
The government should extend this scheme so that is continues for working parents of over-5s and their schools. 
This means that if parents choose, and are able to make a voluntary financial donation to a school, it is not taxed; thus helping to fill the funding gap.

attributes.action: Allow small businesses to have the same consumer rights as an individual.
attributes.background: Small businesses are being targeted by larger businesses to unfair contract terms, outrageous drop out penalties/clauses & higher prices. Yet, because we are a small business we have little or no consumer protection. Help make this change and allow a fairer marketplace for small business consumers.

attributes.action: Get a ban for killing animals for people to eat.
attributes.background: While watching 'Babe' my 6 year old Myla burst into tears while the pigs were being taken to the slaughterhouse and said "this has to stop, mum start a petition to get it stopped". So here we are giving it my best go. Please make a massive change in this world and a little girl happy by signing.

attributes.action: Ensure that the triple lock on the Basic State Pension is removed.
attributes.background:
The triple lock is a guarantee to increase the state pension by a minimum of 2.5% a year. 

Guaranteed rises in the state pension worsen generational inequality.
attributes.additional_details: With the EU Referendum in mind it is more important than ever that we are all affected equally by our economic policy decisions.

attributes.action: Divert our "special relationship" from USA to Mexico.
attributes.background: We have a "special relationship" with America. It means nothing at all - there are no favours through that relationship.
attributes.additional_details: It is symbolic and I don’t think we should be symbolically aligning to somewhere run by someone who makes inappropriate remarks about children, who imposes executive orders which may be illegal.

attributes.action: Focus a larger portion of the defence budget on service personel.
attributes.background: Early terminations from the armed forces is at an all time high. The priorities of the chain of comand are certainly proportionally aimed at staff retention. However new legislation brought by the Army2020, such as, the planned scrapping of the commitment bonus scheme contradicts this completely.
attributes.additional_details: Other plans such as the increase in prices for SFA to bring it into line with the private housing market are evidence of the mindless eradication of the few remaining factors that keep todays service men and women HAPPY to remain in the services. Pensions, pay, accommodation cost, catering contracts, SFA standards, the CarillionAmey contract for the MoD estate. ALL of these points need addressing in order to provide the level of retention the army needs to function.

attributes.action: Assaults on emergency personnel the same penalty as assaulting a police officer
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services are being assaulted. This should not be tolerated and should be felt with as severely as Assaulting a Police Officer. This type of abuse must be severely dealt with.
attributes.additional_details: Having known personnel in the emergency service and hearing they are abused nearly everyday.  We have a duty to support them like they do us, when we need them to save our lives.

attributes.action: Publish a White Paper on the Brexit plan before Parliament's vote on Article 50
attributes.background: The Government should be transparent and accountable to Parliament with regards to its plans for negotiations to exit the EU. A White Paper setting out its plans should be published to enable proper debate in Parliament before the vote on triggering Article 50.

attributes.action: Allow carers to still get paid when, the person they care for is hospitalised.
attributes.background:
Change the cruel rule, where if the person you care for is hospitalised, you have payment stopped, full time careers still have to pay their bills, & sometimes still have to care for that person whilst in hospital.
Or do you expect them to somehow get a job for the duration of the hospital stay?

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for street lights to utilize motion sensors to turn them on.
attributes.background: I believe that there is no need for street lights to be turned on when they are not in use. This is a waste of energy. My solution for this is to make it mandatory for street lights to incorporate motion sensors to activate them, therefore will only be turned on when they will be utilized.

attributes.action: All car drivers should be made to do a CPC course like professional drivers.
attributes.background: Driving on today's roads are very challenging and dangerous, when I was recently in a speeding awareness course, 19 out of 20 people where totally clueless about lots of rules and regulations from the highway code, everybody must be retrained for everybody's safety

attributes.action: UK to vote on whether we wish to remain in union with Scotland
attributes.background:
PM Theresa May will be entering into Brexit negotiations with Nicola Sturgeon hanging around her leg like an anchor.
The time has come for the UK to vote on whether we wish to remain in union with Scotland.
attributes.additional_details:
The overwhelming success of the SNP in the 2015 General election.
The ratio of Scottish votes to remain in the EU
The volume of hate and vitriol from our neighbours  in the north
William Wallace
The battle of Bannockburn https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Bannockburn

attributes.action: Penalties for those who park in parent-toddler spaces without children
attributes.background: As a father of two children and a driver, I find it hugely ignorant of those who find it acceptable to park in parent-toddler spaces when they do not have children. There are penalities for parking in a disabled space incorrectly so why not the same for parent-toddler spaces?

attributes.action: I want to lower the abortion limit
attributes.background: A baby is a baby from conception but more so knowing it's got a heartbeat at 6-7 weeks. 24 weeks a baby is developed it can survive. I don't agree that a baby can be born before 24 weeks and they won't save it but as soon as it's over 24 weeks they will fight to save the baby.
attributes.additional_details: The abortion limit needs to be lowered to below 12 weeks!!

attributes.action: Declassify intelligence related to possible Russian interference on Brexit vote
attributes.background: The CIA, FBI and NSA jointly concluded that Vladimir Putin ordered an influence campaign on the 2016 US Election using social media and cyber attacks. Russia would benefit from a weakened European Union. We deserve to be sure the EU Referendum was a free and fair vote without influence.
attributes.additional_details:
US declassified report: https://www.dni.gov/files/documents/ICA_2017_01.pdf

EU sanctioned Russia over crisis in Syria: https://europa.eu/newsroom/highlights/special-coverage/eu_sanctions_en

Like the US Election, the EU Referendum result was not predicted by polls: http://whatukthinks.org/eu/opinion-polls/poll-of-polls/

MI6 Chief, Anthony Young, commented states "further their aims deniably" by "subversion of democratic process": https://www.ft.com/content/2a433552-bd4c-11e6-8b45-b8b81dd5d080

attributes.action: I propose we have a referendum to change the current immigration rules.
attributes.background:
I would like to prevent the following countries citizens from immigrating to the UK for security concerns.
Indonesia
Pakistan
Bangladesh
Nigeria
Iran
Turkey
Egypt
Algeria
Morocco
Iraq
Sudan
Saudi Arabia
Afghanistan
Ethiopia
Uzbekistan
Yemen
Niger
Somalia

attributes.action: Compulsory for all non UK residents/visitors to have Gov't run comp medical ins
attributes.background: I've just read about the NHS being £30m in debt to medical tourism and this is isn't the first time I've read about the strain on the NHS from non residents coming here for the maternity/cancer/medical care.Gov needs to operate a scheme for all visitors to have comp care cover before admittance
attributes.additional_details: Please see 120 individual NHS Trust accounts for the amount owed individually for medical tourism.

attributes.action: The Government should recognise Taiwan's right for national self determination.
attributes.background: The UK Government should revise its view of the 'One China Policy' to recognize that Taiwan is a beacon of democracy in Asia and that it is for the people of Taiwan to decide their future and not the Chinese Communist Party, which is known to be an authoritarian and oppressive government.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is not about requesting that the UK Government recognises Taiwan as a country but instead that it recognises that it is for the people of Taiwan to determine their future free of threats from the Chinese Government.

The Chinese Government's claim to control the destiny of the people Taiwan is a dangerous and outdated philosophy based on colonialism. This is because although Taiwan was once part of mainland China it has not been for almost a 120 years.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for office buildings to keep interior lighting on after hours.
attributes.background: Whilst out and about London recently on a Saturday night, I was struck by how many empty office buildings were lit up across the city with nobody at their desks. This is a massive waste of energy and resources and flies in the face of the Government commitment to reducing carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Ban Strobe Lighting at Events like concerts etc
attributes.background: In the UK 1 in 103 people suffer from a form of epilepsy. Epileptics should be able to enjoy live music, films, shows, clubs etc. I am not asking for the occasional strobe to be banned but I am asking that excessive strobe lighting be banned.

attributes.action: Diwali is Hindu festival and for lot of Hindu it is also their New year as well.
attributes.background: If Diwali is made as a National Holiday like Christmas then it will save Hindu people to use their holiday

attributes.action: Oblige UK banks to provide instant debit card cash deposits in the Post Office
attributes.background: The Banks’ closure programmes are unfair, particularly to their rural customers, personal & small business, and those who cannot travel far. The Government must oblige all UK banks to provide instant debit card cash deposit facilities via the Post Office as part of their branch closures programmes
attributes.additional_details:
Presently, just a few banks allow customers to deposit cash using their debit cards.
The bank closures are forcing personal & small business customers to deposit cash in a local Post office using the customer's paying-in slips, with delays of 2-3 days before crediting the customer's account: This is profitable to the banks to the cost of their customers.
This petition asks the Government to only allow future bank closures, if the bank has put actions in place to stop this unfair practice.

attributes.action: Stop phone  calling. Make it illegal to withhold a company phone number.
attributes.background: Anonymous phone calls, often 10 a day are causing great distress to many people especially the elderly. The telephone preference service does not work; companies either ignore it or say that we contacted them or showed interest when we did not. They are an unacceptable nuisance.

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls!
attributes.background:
Their is no need for the Severn bridge to have tolls! It is proven that they don't need it anymore. It makes 90 million and the mantence costs are 15 million...so where's the rest of the money going?! 

You don't pay to go to Scotland....so why do we have to pay to go to Wales.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 overall revenue from the tolls was over £90m, while it had been suggested that maintenance costs amounted to between £13m and £15m.

It would be a major boost for the Welsh ecomony, but it is getting held back from getting that vital boost.

attributes.action: Create an age and licence type restriction for drivers of more powerful cars
attributes.background: Young bikers are restricted as to how powerful a bike they can ride based on their age & licence type, yet car drivers can drive any car at any age once they've passed a manual test. This leaves fast cars in the hands of people who aren't competent to drive them, and is also unfair to bikers.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics from 2011 show that 22% of road fatalities in that year involved drivers aged 17-24. A motorcycle-style age and licence grading system needs to be enforced to reduce these figures.

attributes.action: Update the infrastructure for Army families in Woolwich
attributes.background: The soldiers & their families in Woolwich living in Service Family Accommodation don't enjoy Fibre Broadband despite surrounding areas being connected. Internet is used to stay in touch with loved ones (deployed) and it's a disgrace that for economic reasons infrastructure is left outdated.
attributes.additional_details: All parties in relation to the issue have been contacted with no result so far in 2 years. BT and Virgin cannot make a business case and the MoD told us residents need to self-fund fibre. Self funding however is not an option for a large portion of soldier families being attached to The Vikings, who re-locate every 5 years! The council has no jurisdiction. We've been left to struggle with inconceivably slow broadband surrounded by private housing with fibre access, in a London suburb in zone 4.

attributes.action: Stop all ivory trade from the UK and press for bans globally
attributes.background: Ivory collected after 1947 is currently illegal globally, however, Britain still exports legal Ivory to many countries such as Hong Kong, this  contributes greatly to the Ivory trade and can help salesmen conceal their illegal imports from across Africa, drastically harming elephant populations.

attributes.action: Find accommodation for all unaccompanied children stranded in  Calais Jungle
attributes.background:
1500 children stranded in containers and tents around the area known as the Jungle in Calais urgently need appropriate housing 
& support,
 To leave unaccompanied minors who have been left to fend for themselves  is immoral, unsafe and reckless.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/the-calais-jungle-has-become-like-lord-of-the-flies-with-1500-children-left-behind-in-containers-and-a7388021.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/calais-jungle-latest-refugee-children-unaccompanied-minors-camp-migrants-destroyed-relocated-moved-a7386551.html

attributes.action: To create separate employment laws for big businesses & micro/small businesses.
attributes.background: Corporate law does not recognise that small business cannot afford to offer the same 'rights' as big business, such as lengthy paid maternity/paternity leave etc. However, it can offer a more rewarding work environment, where every employee is an individual who is vitally important to the business.
attributes.additional_details: Because every person counts in a small business, it cannot afford to lose an employee for extended periods and pay cover. But by choosing to work in a micro/small business, employees could opt for shorter paid maternity/paternity leave, fewer paid sick days etc. in exchange for other benefits such as greater flexibility in working time & time off. Plus an environment where each employee is vitally important to the success of the business and there is greater equality between the boss and staff.

attributes.action: Justice for children. Tougher prison sentences for paedophiles, 15 years minimum
attributes.background: Paedophiles are protected by an out of date legal system. They are protected in prison and given a new identity once free. A paedophile or sex offender never truly faces their disgusting crimes, while the children and families have to deal with it forever.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophiles should be forced to mix with the general population of a prison - why should they be kept safe? A child will never be able to forget what they have been through, while the paedophiles are set free after a few years to do it to another child. How can parents protect their children from a paedophile when they are so well hidden?

attributes.action: Bring back the paper tax disc.
attributes.background: Bring back the paper tax disc, as you can view the tax disc on your screen and can be seen, that you have a tax disc and have the tax, as people are not paying the tax, as well all the tax should go towards the up keep of the road only and not to be used with other tax.
attributes.additional_details: The DVLA hasn't done enough to tell people when they need to pay. When your tax is due, you get a reminder letter, but this is not enough for thousands of people, who forget their renewal date, and can face a fine of up to £1,000.

attributes.action: Make it law that animals microchips come with a tracking device
attributes.background: Get these dogs and cats safe by having a microchip with a tracker in it and then people can locate their pets when they go missing

attributes.action: Raise the UK speed limit on Motorways and major a roads to 85
attributes.background: Will help with the flow of traffic on major A roads and motorways
attributes.additional_details: Most people already speed on motorways and major A roads and everybody know so  it so instead make it legal instead of illegal.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to force pupils to sing religious songs
attributes.background: It is still legal to let a school punish students (through detentions ect...) for not singing religious songs when the songs doesn't apply to their religion or they're not religious at all... this outdated law should be removed
attributes.additional_details: The law states that religious and non religious schools must take part in some form of collective worship and that it must only be of christian character which isn't reflective of the demographic

attributes.action: Make child benefit rules fairer
attributes.background: Currently couples with one partner earning over 60 thousand pounds annually are not entitled to any child benefit. If however both parents are working and they earn over 60 thousand pounds combined but with both individully earning less than that amount, they are entitled to this benefit.
attributes.additional_details: A couple may earn 55 thousand pounds each and get child benefit however if one person earns 60 thousand they do not.

attributes.action: Create a specialist police unit to deal with modern day slavery.
attributes.background: Modern day slavery is a big issue in the UK with the amount of people referred to the National Referral Mechanism up. I believe that the UK Government should create a national modern slavery unit to crack down on modern day slave owners and the human traffickers that get them into the country.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government's Modern Slavery Strategy:
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/383764/Modern_Slavery_Strategy_FINAL_DEC2015.pdf

The National Crime Agency's statistics on Slavery:
http://www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk/publications/national-referral-mechanism-statistics

attributes.action: Take action against France for enforcing the Burkini ban
attributes.background: The Burkini is a full body Swimsuit which covers everything apart from the face, feet and hands. So far authorities in 15 French towns have banned the wearing of Burkinis following completely unrelated terrorist attacks.
attributes.additional_details:
The Burkini enables women who wish to cover their bodies access to beaches and public spaces. The wearing of the outfit is completely unrelated to the attacks carried out against France. We feel that the Burkini ban infringes on women's freedom to access public spaces and to wear what they desire. The burkini ban also goes against the UDHR (Universal Declaration of Human Rights). 
We urge the British government to advise the French government to seriously reconsider the ban on Burkinis.

attributes.action: Include the advertising ban and mandatory targets in the anti-obesity strategy.
attributes.background: We believe that the government's anti-obesity strategy does not go far enough. We want the advertising of junk food to be banned until after the watershed and for the manufacturers of junk food to have mandatory targets for sugar and fat content. We also demand that schools sell healthy lunches.
attributes.additional_details: See the Public Health England report: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/sugar-reduction-from-evidence-into-action

attributes.action: Educate society about Epilepsy and eradicate the stigma surrounding it
attributes.background: More than 500,000 people in the UK have epilepsy, which is a condition that affects the brain and causes repetitive seizures. There is a stigma around epilepsy that needs to be addressed, starting with the lack of knowledge the public have about what to do when someone has a seizure.
attributes.additional_details: Educating children from a young age in a First Aid class would severely decrease the stigma around epilepsy and therefore allow those with epilepsy to feel more accepted in the community. By placing a programme of First Aid in primary and secondary schools where children learn about what to do when witnessing a seizure- not touching the person or placing anything in their mouths etc- would make epilepsy a much less lonely and frightening condition.

attributes.action: Declare a national day of mourning when David Attenborough dies.
attributes.background: All non-essential services stop (most offices, shops etc) in order for all to stay home and watch his programmes.

attributes.action: Urge the US president to apologise for humiliating Johnson Beharry VC
attributes.background:
The PM should make direct representations to POTUS and demand a public apology be made to HMQEII.

Johnson Beharry VC was delayed entry to the US after the POTUS ordered travel restrictions on 27 January 2017. He missed a veterans' event where he was due to be a guest of honour.
attributes.additional_details:
Johnson Beharry VC is a member of the British Army who won the UK's highest military honour for bravery in Iraq in 2004. He suffered significant injury in doing so. He described he "felt humiliated" during recent experience at JFK Airport.

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/donald-trump-muslim-ban-johnson-beharry-victoria-cross-humiliated-a7563451.html

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/johnson-beharry-victoria-cross-war-hero-humiliated-donald-trump-travel-ban_uk_58970829e4b0768562164564

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4192774/Victoria-Cross-war-hero-Johnson-Beharry-humiliated-US-border-officials.html

http://www.standard.co.uk/news/world/victoria-cross-hero-johnson-beharry-humiliated-after-being-caught-up-in-donald-trumps-travel-ban-a3458696.html

attributes.action: Funds to support community fridge's around the U.K.
attributes.background:
To have community fridges available to help homeless and people on low income or unemployed. 

Allow businesses and public to donate unwanted food into community fridges to help people who can't afford or struggling to feed family.

attributes.action: Advise Monarch to exercise the prerogative of mercy for Charles Bronson.
attributes.background: We would like the government to approach and advise the Monarch to exercise the prerogative of mercy for Micheal Peterson AKA Charles Bronson. As I'm sure you know this man has spent 40+ years in prison,although this man may have done wrong in the past this is excessive.
attributes.additional_details: The sentence is excessive for anyone let alone someone who has never murdered anyone, he has spent a good 80% of his sentence in solitary confinement. This man has served more then his fare share of prison time and should be released immediately. There is no question he may not have been an role model prisoner in the past, but just a simple Internet search will reveal that this man is reformed and draws and sells on his artwork for many charities.

attributes.action: Change Use Class C3 wording to prevent LTD Company abuse of “Lawful Development”
attributes.background: Planning regs. Use Class C3 wording should be changed to “up to six people living together as a single household and receiving care from non-residential carers” to stop multimillion £ Ltd Companies using private residential houses as care homes without requiring planning permission for change of use
attributes.additional_details:
Councils are consistently concluding that a change of use DOES occur.  

Some are rejecting applications and some are issuing certificates on the basis that the change does not constitute a MATERIAL change in use in PLANNING TERMS.

Application DA/2015/0762 in Daventry District Council and SL/2016/0608 South Lakeland District Council were both submitted by the same company with a multi-million £ turnover citing the same evidence.  One rejected, the other permitted. 

Two of many inconsistencies.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to discriminate uniform between boys and girls
attributes.background: Schools all around the UK make children wear separate uniforms, this causes problems to arise through clashes of opinion in terms of what parents thinks children should wear and what the school demands that they wear. In this world of 'equality' surely we should start at the route of inequality.

attributes.action: Protect non-resident parents with the introduction of a '3 strike' rule.
attributes.background: Parents awarded a residency / contact order should be held in check with a three strike rule that will revert residency to the other parent if they are deemed to be persistently violating an order, to prevent abuse, intimidation and instabilty for any children or adults involved.
attributes.additional_details:
http://theparentconnection.org.uk/articles/what-happens-if-a-former-partner-breaches-contact-order-arrangements

http://www.courtroomadvice.co.uk/breach-court-order-what-steps-take-next.html

This is intended to ensure that court orders made to the rights of the children are recognised by all parental / guardian parties, and not abused for the sake of intimidation, extortion, emotional blackmail or abuse.

attributes.action: Before any vote on Article 50 the government must publish the trade consequences
attributes.background: MP's would be stupid to trigger Article 50 without first knowing the trade rules that would come into effect as a result. The referendum ballot did not permit MP's to be irresponsible. The public have a right to know what trade rules MPs will put in place if they decide to vote to trigger Article 50
attributes.additional_details: Only 37% of the electorate voted "leave". The vast majority of the electorate want conditions to improve following any parliamentary vote on Article 50. MPs must be able to assure the public that if they vote to trigger Article 50, trading relations will not be worsened and restrictions will not be placed on financial institutions that will damage our economy. Therefore before any parliamentary vote on Article 50, MPs must publish in full all the arrangements that will then come into effect.

attributes.action: Allow 16/17 year olds to vote.
attributes.background: In Year 9 in secondary school we are made to choose our GCSE subjects, at 16 we can smoke, win the lottery have sex, get a job. At 17 you can drive and you start choosing your University/life root and yet we cannot vote until we're 18. WE as a generation are one of the most educated ever. FIX IT.

attributes.action: Reduce the Overseas Aid Budget from 0.7% of GDP to 0.6% of GDP.
attributes.background: The UK Overseas Aid Budget at 0.71% is the 5th highest of all European countries.   I suggest that it is reduced to 0.6% and that the cash difference be invested in our NHS.   The reduction amounts to approximately £1.4bn p.a.and so would fund the increasing needs of the NHS on an annual need.
attributes.additional_details:
With increasing demands on the NHS through an ageing and increasing population, the NHS needs more money.   We spend 8.5% of GDP (based on 2015 data) against an average in Europe of 8.9% and are the 10th highest spender of 10 listed countries.   We are the 5th higher contributor to Overseas Aid of 10 listed countries.  Germany & France spend considerably less on Overseas Aid than the UK - but considerably more on their NHS.  
Sources:  Wikepedia & Kings Fund
